climbs.name: Welcome to the Dark Side
climbs.fa: Kris Carpenter, Brian Ketron, Mike Melkonian, Scott Sederstrom

content.description: Climb the two-bolt start of 'Warrior Waitress' and then head right on the upper face after the ledge.  Climbs the steep face and arete, staying to the right of the arete.  Great climbing.
content.location: Shares the same start as 'Warrior Waitress', the trends right off the ledge towards the arete.

content.description: Thin and sharp face climbing to an interesting section up round holds. Have an attentive belayer for the crux moves off the ledge.

P1: Start on the right side of Cannibal finger crack in a "squeeze" corner. Follow it up and stop in a cave like place. Gear anchor. 5.8, 120'.

P2: Continue up through steep 5.9 crack. Climbing get easier after that. Go left targeting top of the dome and look down for rappel anchors. 5.9, 80'.

Descend: Two single rope rappels.

Begin on a ledge, where the start of the thin crack would've been obstructed by a large tree if belayed from the ground.  Up the overhanging finger crack, passing a vertical "open tomb" feature right of that crack.  Overcome the steepness to some reassuring hands.  Continue up the rest of the now easier crack to the topout ledge.  First half is the fantastic fun, despite the casual top half finish.  Located to the immediate left of Jammin' With Jane.

After a scramble up, you start chugging up some wide crack that eventually leads to a mini roof and easy top out. You can start either left or right of the pyramidal base block. The left start is wide (5" - 6" protection), while the right has more protection and no wideness. Either way should be casual. The meat of the climb awaits, including a full course of face moves to cupped hands and fists. Jammin' With Jane is a fun climb and good warm up for the area.
content.protection: Medium nuts, small cams to 3.5", gear anchor consisting of medium nuts to gear from 1" to 4". Rappel Warrior Waitress or what is called Caravans in the Lewis/Croft guidebook.
content.location: The crack to the left of the obvious face climbs, Warrior Waitress and Welcome to the Dark Side

content.description: Climb dihedral, then arete. Lower off.

Steep and fun bouldery tips off the ground, then thru the bulge into wide fingers to a rest on a giant round knob (if you need it...) where the angle kicks back a little.  Nice and easy fingers afterward to the anchors.

Some find the first sequence is the crux while others feel it's the rattly fingers.  Decide for yourself.

climbs.name: Arabesque
climbs.fa: Dean Hobbs, Grant Hiskes, Scott Cole, 1980s

content.description: An easy scramble of a start leads to a pretty cool dihedral finger crack. After that you continue up a ramp feature before departing on the glorious two bolt journey up to the Welcome to the Dark Side anchors.
content.protection: Small to 4", two bolt anchor shared with Welcome to the Dark Side
content.location: The crack system just right and and around the corner from Welcome to the Dark Side

content.description:
...We Salute You (ACDC)

A great route for this area! Kind of soft for the grade (11a in guidebook) but it is a must do!

Go up an easy corner with a vibrating spike and get good Yellow-Red Aliens. Next is a very unnecessary upward-driven angle piton that (IMO) should be removed. Better Green Alien(s) around the pin can be placed. Sweet underclings with lots good gear move you out right to where it eases and turns into a vertical flake. Go to an anchor that needs extra links on the hangers.
content.protection:
Doubles of Green to Red Aliens (one .5 BD Camalot may work better at the crux) and (one each) #.75 through #3 Camalots

2 quicklinks will straighten out the anchor.
content.location: You can't miss this cool looking undercling feature!
